text: today's recipe is a creamy lemon pasta
it's a little bit of a take on a
carbonara but it's vegetarian starting
off by cooking 12 ounces of pasta
spaghetti and then I'm gonna get my
lemon component ready you need two and a
half teaspoons of grated lemon zest
make sure you've scrubbed your lemons so
there's no wax or residue on there and
if possible get organic because if
you're gonna be eating the skin
you probably want it to be organic
you'll need two and a half teaspoons of
this grated zest and then some strips of
zest as well for garnish so to get these
strips obsessed you use a vegetable
peeler and just remove the peel and long
strips like that you can also use what's
known as a channel zester that makes its
own little strips they come out kind of
curly and cute but I always just use the
vegetable peeler method stack them up
and then cut them into thin strips as
you can if you use a really nice sharp
knife you should be able to do this
easily you can set aside your strips for
later and then you also need about two
teaspoons of lemon juice this is a nice
juicy lemon so your half a lemons gonna
give you a lot more than two teaspoons
but that's okay you can save the rest of
the lemon for something else it's topped
with some buttery bread crumbs and I
like to make my breadcrumbs fresh with
white bread just a nice white sandwich
bread two slices should make enough
bread crumbs for this recipe you're
gonna need about a cup just give them a
pulse in here you want coarse red crumbs
you don't want it too fine so don't go
too fast nice of course some bigger
pieces some smaller pieces that's the
way that I like it
so heat a skillet over a medium-high
heat and add two tablespoons of butter
the pasta you want to cook about two
minutes less than
directed times on the package so that
when you finish this dish which gets
tossed with pasta water etc it is nice
and al dente so keep an eye on it or set
a timer breadcrumbs go in they're gonna
take about three minutes to get nice and
golden-brown you cook those with about a
teaspoon of your grated lemon zest the
fine stuff and some salt and pepper
towstee golden I love to add a little
bit of crunch at the end of my pasta and
this one in addition to the breadcrumbs
also has some chopped up pistachios when
they're golden brown you just transfer
them to a bowl and get them cool this
gives them additional time to crisp up
as well so just let these cool while
your pasta finishes cooking okay to
finish your pasta you're gonna make like
a creamy egg sauce and that's what
carbonara does as well you take raw eggs
and you cook it by tossing the hot pasta
in it in this bowl I have two egg yolks
and to that add two large eggs so it's
total before but you only have the
whites of two I find that makes it nice
and creamy without having it taste too
eggy if you know what I mean - the eggs
you're gonna add two tablespoons of
heavy cream 2 cups of grated Parmesan
cheese it's about 4 ounces total
and the remaining lemon zest about one
and a half teaspoons of lemon zest
you're still saving those little shreds
for garnish whisk this all together and
now you want to drain your pasta it
should be done by now so reserve about a
cup of pasta water it helped thin out
the whole mixture if it's necessary
[Applause]
and now what you do is add your hot
pasta directly into the bowl with the
egg mixture this is going to coat your
pasta really really nicely and it will
cook the eggs so they're no longer raw
four tablespoons of unsalted butter if
it's room temperature it'll melt more
quickly and those two teaspoons of juice
which I have way more than so boom boom
and just keep stirring until a really
nice creamy sauce is formed now at this
point if it's necessary or as it sits
you might need to add some pasta water
just a little bit I don't really feel
like I need to so much right now but
just so you know it's there for you if
you wanted to garnish with something
else besides pistachios maybe we don't
like them you don't have them poppy
seeds are also really really nice here
the savory take on a classic combination
and then that's it serve it up it only
takes about 15 minutes start to finish
to make this dish which is another great
thing about this for serving during the
week quick and easy and so satisfying
really garnish bread crumbs add your
crunch some of these pistachios some of
